ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: it fluctuates during different sections. Average 6 hours per week.
about 5 h
3 hours
20 hours per week
6 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: It is more practical than theoretical. I like to know the principles before I learn how to achieve it in the SAS, but the class is focusing on the latter. I think it would be better helping me to interpret results if I know the mechanism first.
useful course on modeling and using data if there are more practical questions for students to solve, it would be better.
This course is useful

The lectures are informative and discuss the selected topics very clearly. Both our theoretical knowledge and SAS programming skills can be improved by the combination of lectures and lab sessions. The lecture notes are well organized and to the point, which makes it easy to review after class.
It's very clear and easy to understand even for layman.
Great.
Strength: The course materials are really helpful. Weakness: Instructor's presentation skills. Workload of this course is really large. Lack of HW solutions.
The final project is almost unrelated to the contents of lectures. The most important points in the final project was even not covered.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  The instructor is kind of shy and struggling with her speaking. But once you get used to it, you will find she makes the explanation plain and detailed. Her slides are concise and the textbook she is using is very informative.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Her oral English needs to be improved

Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Very friendly and responsive, she clearly wants to help students succeed. She struggles to keep control of the classroom, however, as a large majority of students are ignoring her as she speaks (talking among themselves, laughing, coming late and leaving early, playing games on their computers, etc.). I would love to see her get the respect in the classroom that she deserves, although she may need to be more assertive in commanding it.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Great
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Prof. Wang is good, very professional in catogorical data analysis and modeling. if lectures can be taught more clearly, that would be perfect.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Her lecture notes are very organized

Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Dr. Wang's lectures are informative and helpful and the lecture notes are a great complement or summary of the textbook. Dr. Wang is also kind and responsive to our questions. Discussion with her after class helps me a lot in learning this course.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  She helps me a lot!
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  She is a great instructor. If her spoken English is better, this course would be perfect.

Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Prof. Wang is really nice. However, her presentation skills really need to be improved. In addition, I would suggest to use R as the primary language for this course, since both Prof. Wang and the TA are more familiar with R. Lastly, it would be really helpful if there are solutions for homework assignments.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, the course is useful for people who want to improve their analysis skills on categorical data which is pretty common in any study. You need to focus during the class and you will gain.

This is an important course for almost all students in public health. Although it is not the highest quality course, in the end the content is more important than the hours of the class (3-5 pm on Wednesdays and 3 pm on Fridays) and the amount of work.
yes, very helpful when learning how to deal with catogorical data.
Yes, I would recommend it to others.
The course is helpful for acquiring theoretical knowledge as well as for applying them. The workload is not heavy. I would recommend it to students who are interest in this field.
If you're interesting on categorical data, you should attend this course.
It is a good class
This course is helpful, but could be improved in the future.
Good
